questions.question: The Protestant Reformation and the Renaissance were similar in that both:

choices.answer: discouraged the growth of strong monarchs
were led by the military
encouraged people to question tradition
supported the return of the Roman Empire

questions.question: Martin Luther’s Ninety-Five Theses were a call for:

choices.answer: religious revolt against the German princes
reforms within the Roman Catholic Church
greater papal authority
crusades to spread Christianity
creating overseas colonies
forbidding colonies to trade with other nations
enforcing high taxes and tariffs on imported goods
all of the above

questions.question: One factor that enabled the Renaissance to flourish in Italy was that the region had:

choices.answer: a wealthy merchant class that invested in the arts
limited contact with the Byzantine Empire
a socialist form of government
a shrinking middle class

questions.question: ___________________ refers to the rebirth of art, culture and commerce in Europe during the 14th through 17th centuries.

choices.answer: Reformation
Constitution
Renaissance
Moratorium
The trip enslaved Africans took between Africa and their next destination
The middle of the night in Egypt
The middle of the trip between Ghana and the Congo
The middle of the trip between Algeria and South Africa

questions.question: When Martin Luther said “my conscience is captive to the Word of God,” he was referring to his belief in:

choices.answer: the supremacy of the Bible over Church policies
imprisoning those who disagreed with Church teachings
maintaining the unity of the Church
the need for nepotism

questions.question: Who of the following was not a European explorer during the “Age of Exploration”?

choices.answer: Christopher Columbus
Ferdinand Magellan
Leonardo da Vinci
Juan Ponce de Leon

questions.question: Why did the Native American population of Mexico decrease during the Age of Exploration?

choices.answer: crop failures brought on by poor weather conditions
wars fought among various tribes
movement of Native Americans to Africa
diseases brought to North America by the Spanish colonists

questions.question: The Columbian Exchange refers to the:

choices.answer: spread of nationalism around the world
transporting of slaves to the Americas
flow around the world of new plants, diseases, and people
trade of land between Spain and Portugal

questions.question: What was one ideal of Renaissance humanism?

choices.answer: training as a knight and practicing chivalry
living apart from the world and taking monastic vows
obeying divine right monarchs and the church
investigating areas of interest and fulfilling one’s potential

questions.question: A country has a favorable balance of trade when...

choices.answer: imports and exports are of equal value.
exports are of greater value than imports.
imports are of greater value than exports.
imports and exports are increasing annually.

questions.question: What caused Luther’s call for the Catholic Church to reform?

choices.answer: He disagreed with the system of popes as religious leaders.
The Church did not stress enough faith and good works.
The emperor made him an outlaw by the Edict of Worms.
The widespread selling of indulgences, among other abuses, angered him.
the human mind is divine.
the human mind is perfect.
matter matters.
reason is the chief source of knowledge.
deductive reasoning to solve nature’s puzzles.
the wisdom of ancient scientists.
inductive reasoning to find specific truth from basic facts.
assumptions that were not observed.
